intro: Callicoma, commonly known as the false heather, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Malvaceae. It comprises several species, most of which are shrubs or small trees native to Australia. The plants are characterized by their showy, often pink or red flowers that appear in clusters. They have simple, alternate leaves and produce capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Callicoma species are adapted to a variety of habitats, including coastal areas and dry forests.
